title: Three-cent nickel
summary: The copper-nickel three-cent piece, often called a three-cent nickel piece or three-cent nickel, was designed by US Mint Chief Engraver James B. Longacre and struck by the United States Bureau of the Mint from 1865 to 1889.  It was initially popular, but its place in commerce was supplanted by the five-cent piece, or nickel.
